title: Alternative to Mrs. Eaves needed
content:
hi - first post to the board..

I am working on a huge project, trying to find a warm, "imperfect" serif typeface akin to Mrs. Eaves (and Filosofia) . I have spent over 4 days searching and exploring with not too much success, so any pointers would be greatly appreciated. The closest I've come are Fountain type faces, but most of these are a bit too stiff for me.

Keywords:

Warm, human, well crafted, imperfect, vintage, hopefully a comprehensive number of weights.

By "imperfect" I mean that it does not matter if the typeface jumps a bit, like Eaves or is a bit uneven, as long as it gives off that familiar "warmth".

My last ditch effort would be to loosely interpret a given font by hand (pen/paper), but I haven't even been able to find a decent starting point.

please help - Thanks!
author: tokeloke

comments.content:
Have you seen Dino dos Santos' typefaces?  
 [www.dstype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.dstype.com/ "www.dstype.com")

I think you will get a number of good suggestions, but for myself,  
when I think "better Mrs Eaves", I think of The Foundry's Wilson:  
 [http://www.foundrytypes.co.uk/foundry\_wilson/wilson\_book.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.foundrytypes.co.uk/foundry_wilson/wilson_book.html "http://www.foundrytypes.co.uk/foundry\_wilson/wilson\_book.html")

A much rougher option would be Founder's Caslon:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/founders-caslon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/founders-caslon/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/founders-caslon/")

hhp

FF Tibere seems to be a competitive design.  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_tibere/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_tibere/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_tibere/")

Two of my many imperfect designs:  
 [Oneleigh](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_oneleigh_pro_regular/)  
 [Paradigm](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.shinntype.com/paradigm.html)

for imperfection and atmosphere maybe take a look at MVB Sirenne.  
I once chose Fred Smeijers’ Custodia when I was looking for something similar, but it only comes in two weights at the moment (he's working on expanding it though).  
 [www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/sirenne/about\_sirenne.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/sirenne/about_sirenne.htm "www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/sirenne/about\_sirenne.htm")  
 [www.ourtype.be](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.ourtype.be/ "www.ourtype.be")

It's subtle, but these Czech versions of the classic face have some imperfection and warmth not available in other cuts.

1. [Baskerville Original](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-22-baskerville-original)  
2. [Baskerville 10 Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-77-baskerville-10-pro)

What about this one, recently posted here:

[http://typophile.com/node/64797](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/typophile.com/node/64797 "http://typophile.com/node/64797")

hi guys - really appreciate this - checking your suggestions out, I have had eyes on Feijoa and now Typonine's Tempera (the Biblio serif'ed version is maybe not exactly imperfect and warm, but the entire set is very flexible, and from what I can see, well executed)

Will keep looking, so keep the suggestions coming! Thanks again for taking the time.
Throwing in my two cents on behalf of FF Atma.

try [Absara](http://web.archive.org/web/20141013175613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/super_families/ff_absara/)  
it has lots of weights and a sans

Poliphilus has loads of warmth but no extra weights  
which for this font is correct
